value.message:
Update NuGet package versions in project files

Upgraded Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.CodeGeneration.Design to 10.0.1 in both PromptSpark.Domain.csproj and WebSpark.Portal.csproj. Also updated Scalar.AspNetCore to 2.11.10 in WebSpark.Portal.csproj.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Remove redundant NuGet packages, update deps, use C# 12

Removed unnecessary and redundant NuGet package references (e.g., System.Text.Json, System.Private.Uri, System.Formats.Asn1, etc.) from all projects, as detailed in the new nuget-package-review.md. Updated all package versions to latest stable releases for consistency. Refactored codebase to use C# 12 collection expressions ([.. collection]) instead of .ToList()/.ToArray() for conciseness. Cleaned up project files, excluded build-time infra from publish, and added missing/updated packages where needed. All changes validated: build succeeds, all functionality preserved, and all NuGet warnings eliminated. Added nuget-package-review.md for audit trail and future maintenance guidance.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
003 seo optimization portal (#4)

* feat(seo): Add comprehensive SEO optimization specification (003)

- Complete SEO overhaul specification for WebSpark.Portal
- 8 prioritized user stories covering discovery, social sharing, duplicate content
- Detailed requirements for metadata, structured data, sitemaps, robots.txt
- 10 measurable success criteria with baselines and targets
- Implementation phases (P1-P3) spanning 5-6 weeks
- Addresses 220+ views across 8 areas (Admin, AsyncSpark, GitHubSpark, Identity, PromptSpark, RecipeSpark, TriviaSpark, WebCMS)
- Focus on Core Web Vitals, Schema.org JSON-LD, Open Graph optimization
- Eliminates duplicate content via canonical URLs and robots.txt
- Includes edge case handling, testing strategy, and risk mitigation

* feat(seo): Add implementation plan for comprehensive SEO optimization overhaul

* feat(seo): Add comprehensive tasks for SEO optimization overhaul in WebSpark.Portal

* feat(seo): Enhance error handling and analytics integration in SEO tasks

* Add comprehensive tests for SEO-related services and image accessibility

- Implemented `ImageAccessibilityTests` to ensure all images in Razor views have proper alt text attributes, enhancing accessibility and SEO.
- Created `NavigationMetadataServiceTests` to validate the functionality of the navigation metadata service, including case insensitivity and hierarchical matching.
- Developed `PaginationMetadataServiceTests` to test pagination URL generation, including handling of query parameters and normalization of paths.
- Updated the test project file to include necessary dependencies for testing.

* feat(seo): Implement comprehensive SEO metadata across controllers and navigation for WebSpark.Portal

- Added SEO metadata (title, description, keywords, NoIndex) to HomeController, ArtInstituteController, CrawlDomainController, and others.
- Enhanced navigation.json with 52 fully qualified entries for various features and categories.
- Ensured dynamic SEO metadata for specific actions, including user-specific titles in GitHubSpark and recipe details in RecipeSpark.
- Established consistent ViewData conventions across all areas to improve SEO performance and user experience.

* feat(seo): Enhance SEO capabilities with structured data and sitemap improvements

- Added structured data service for generating Article, Recipe, HowTo, and FAQPage schemas.
- Integrated structured data into PostController for blog posts.
- Implemented sitemap index and pagination support in SitemapService for handling large sites.
- Extended INavigationMetadataService to provide sitemap values including priority, change frequency, and noIndex flags.
- Updated sitemap generation to include image metadata for rich results.
- Created breadcrumbs view component for improved navigation and SEO.
- Added comprehensive unit tests for SitemapService to ensure correct XML structure and metadata integration.

* feat(seo): Complete Phase 9-10 of SEO Optimization for WebSpark.Portal

- Implemented sitemap optimization with navigation metadata, image support, and sitemap-index for scalability.
- Enhanced analytics and monitoring with GA4 custom dimensions, Web Vitals tracking, and structured logging.
- Added multi-search-engine verification support for Google, Bing, and Yandex.
- Created comprehensive documentation for monitoring and SEO audit logging.
- Achieved 100% test pass rate with 47 tests covering new sitemap features and analytics enhancements.

* Commit changes before fixing global.json file(s).

* Upgrade solution to .NET 10.0

- Updated all 11 projects from net9.0 to net10.0
- Upgraded 21 packages to version 10.0.0
- Fixed Azure.Identity security vulnerability (1.17.0 ? 1.17.1)
- Removed System.Text.RegularExpressions (functionality included in framework)
- Updated Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.CodeGeneration.Design to 10.0.0-rc.1
- Fixed compilation errors related to framework breaking changes
- Verified all tests pass
- Validated all application areas functional

Breaking changes addressed:
- System.Text.RegularExpressions removed from WebSpark.Core and PromptSpark.Domain (functionality now in framework)
- Azure.Identity updated to resolve deprecated MSAL dependency
- All Microsoft packages updated from 9.0.10 to 10.0.0

Projects upgraded:
- WebSpark.Core
- WebSpark.SharedKernel
- WebSpark.UserIdentity
- WebSpark.RecipeCookbook
- PromptSpark.Domain
- TriviaSpark.Domain
- TriviaSpark.JShow
- OpenWeatherMapClient
- WebSpark.Portal
- WebSpark.Portal.Tests
- PromptSpark.SchemaTest

Testing performed:
- All unit tests pass (47/47)
- PromptSpark.SchemaTest executes successfully
- Build succeeded with 0 errors
- Performance benchmarks met

* Upgrade WebSpark solution to .NET 10.0

Updated all 11 project `.csproj` files to target .NET 10.0, completing the Big Bang migration from .NET 9.0. Modified `Index.cshtml` to reflect the upgrade in descriptions and promotional text.

Added a new accordion section in `Index.cshtml` documenting the upgrade process, including:
- Big Bang migration strategy.
- Package modernization (21 NuGet updates).
- Security enhancements (Azure.Identity vulnerability fix).
- Framework optimizations (removed redundant packages).
- Zero build errors and 47/47 unit tests passing.
- SEO improvements (semantic HTML, meta tags, performance, accessibility).

Updated `tasks.md` to mark TASK-004 as complete and reflect 100% progress. Logged the successful upgrade in `.github/upgrades/execution-log.md`, including commit hash and clean working tree status.

This commit demonstrates the use of AI-assisted tools (GitHub Copilot) for efficient migration and modernization.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

Fix security vulnerabilities in npm dependencies

- Update glob from 11.0.0 to 11.1.0 (fixes CVE command injection vulnerability)
- Fix brace-expansion ReDoS vulnerability
- Resolves Dependabot alert #11 (high severity)
- Resolves Dependabot alert #3 (low severity)

All npm audit vulnerabilities now resolved.

value.message:
[001] Spec-Driven Development Workflow - SpecKit Implementation (#3)

* Add GitHubSpark GraphQL Troubleshooting Guide with common issues and solutions

* feat: Add PowerShell script to update agent context files and templates

- Implemented `update-agent-context.ps1` to manage agent context files based on `plan.md`.
- Created agent file template in `.specify/templates/agent-file-template.md`.
- Added checklist template in `.specify/templates/checklist-template.md`.
- Developed implementation plan template in `.specify/templates/plan-template.md`.
- Established feature specification template in `.specify/templates/spec-template.md`.
- Introduced tasks template in `.specify/templates/tasks-template.md`.
- Configured VSCode settings for chat prompt file recommendations and terminal auto-approval.

* feat: Add Spec-Driven Development Workflow Specification and Task Breakdown

- Introduced comprehensive feature specification for Spec-Driven Development Workflow, detailing user stories, acceptance criteria, functional requirements, and success criteria.
- Created tasks.md to outline implementation phases, including setup, foundational prerequisites, user stories, and additional commands.
- Organized tasks by user story for independent implementation and testing, ensuring clear dependencies and execution order.
- Established checkpoints for each phase to validate progress and functionality.

* fix: Clarify success criteria for generated plans and planning time reduction metrics

* feat: Update copilot instructions and implementation plan; add API contract for SpecKit CLI

* feat: Implement branch protection and spec synchronization validators

- Added Test-BranchProtection.ps1 to validate if the current branch is protected (main, master, develop, etc.).
- Added Test-BranchSpecSync.ps1 to ensure branch name matches the corresponding spec folder name.
- Created command workflows for /speckit.critic, /speckit.implement, /speckit.plan, and /speckit.specify with detailed documentation.
- Enhanced README.md with an overview of the SpecKit workflow and its key features.
- Developed comprehensive unit tests for branch protection and spec synchronization functionalities.
- Established a structured directory for specs and templates, ensuring compliance with project standards.
- Introduced shared utility functions for consistent messaging and template expansion.

* feat: Implement administrative commands and finalize documentation for SpecKit

value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Add spec-driven development workflow with protected branch enforcement

- Implement protected branch validation (main, master, develop, etc.)
- Add smart branch name generation with stop-word filtering
- Enforce NNN-short-name format for branches and spec folders
- Update PowerShell scripts with centralized validation functions
- Add comprehensive workflow documentation to constitution and copilot instructions
- Support JSON output mode and non-git fallback
- Enforce GitHub 244-byte branch name limit with warnings

This change implements the complete spec-driven workflow as documented in:
- .specify/scripts/powershell/common.ps1 (validation functions)
- .specify/scripts/powershell/create-new-feature.ps1 (protected branch enforcement)
- .specify/scripts/powershell/setup-plan.ps1 (branch validation)
- .specify/scripts/powershell/check-prerequisites.ps1 (prerequisites validation)
- .specify/memory/constitution.md (workflow rules and rationale)
- .github/copilot-instructions.md (developer guidance)

value.message:
Update ReverseMarkdown and MediatR package versions

Updated ReverseMarkdown to version 4.7.1 in WebSpark.Core.csproj, addressing potential bug fixes or improvements.
Updated MediatR to version 13.1.0 in WebSpark.SharedKernel.csproj, incorporating enhancements or additional functionality.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix DataTables and mobile UX issues in PromptSpark

Resolved DataTables Buttons error on `/userprompts` by adding missing dependencies (`datatables.net-buttons`, `jszip`, `pdfmake`) and updating the build process to include export functionality. Enhanced `Create.cshtml` with improved button styling and mobile-specific textarea behavior.

Improved mobile responsiveness across all PromptSpark forms:
- Added `max-height` constraints for textareas with internal scrolling.
- Increased bottom padding to prevent footer overlap.
- Stacked buttons vertically on smaller screens for better accessibility.

Updated global styles (`_create.scss`, `_explorer.scss`, `styles.scss`) to ensure consistent mobile behavior. Rebuilt JavaScript and CSS bundles to include DataTables extensions and responsive adjustments.

Thoroughly tested fixes across devices and browsers, ensuring WCAG 2.1 AA compliance and production readiness.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Refactor AI recipe generation form and middleware

Refactored the AI recipe generation form by introducing a new `MomCreateRequestModel` with enhanced validation and usability. Updated `HomeController` to use the new model, added detailed logging, and improved error handling. Modified `MomCreate.cshtml` to bind to the new model, added client-side logging, and enhanced form behavior with a loading spinner and autofocus.

Improved middleware in `Program.cs` to skip POST requests in lowercase URL redirection, preventing POST-to-GET conversion issues. Refined conditions for skipping redirection to include static files and SignalR endpoints.

Performed general code cleanup, improved readability, and enhanced user experience with better validation feedback and error messages.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Update Markdig package to version 0.43.0

Updated the `Markdig` package from version `0.42.0` to `0.43.0` in both `WebSpark.Core.csproj` and `WebSpark.Portal.csproj`. This ensures the projects benefit from the latest improvements, bug fixes, and features provided by the updated library.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Add OpenAPI support and update dependencies

Introduce OpenAPI endpoints for API documentation and downloads, including JSON, pretty JSON, and YAML formats. Add a new `ApiDocs` view for interactive documentation and download options. Update `HomeController` with new actions for OpenAPI metadata and file downloads.

Refactor middleware in `Program.cs` to enable OpenAPI and Scalar UI in all environments. Enhance `ApiDocs.cshtml` with detailed API documentation and usage examples.

Upgrade multiple NuGet package dependencies across projects, including `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore`, `System.Text.Json`, `WebSpark.HttpClientUtility`, and others to their latest versions. Ensure consistent versioning for `Microsoft.Build` and `Microsoft.CodeAnalysis` packages.

Improve logging and error handling for OpenAPI-related operations. Add clipboard functionality for copying API links in the `ApiDocs` view.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Modernize PromptSpark UI/UX with Purple Design System

Introduced a modern purple-based theme across the PromptSpark platform, replacing legacy orange styles. Enhanced chat interfaces with real-time connection status, typing indicators, and adaptive card rendering. Improved workflow management with modernized layouts, animations, and responsive design.

Added accessibility features, including high contrast mode, reduced motion support, and focus indicators. Updated navigation with unified headers, breadcrumbs, and floating action buttons. Enhanced database seeding for development environments with realistic data generation.

Refactored SCSS files to align with the new design system, leveraging CSS variables for maintainability. Improved JavaScript build process with markdown parsing and sanitization. Optimized performance with GPU-accelerated animations and lazy loading. Ensured consistent theming and functionality across all components.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Enhance PromptSpark architecture and functionality

- Updated `_ViewStart.cshtml` to use area-specific layout.
- Added new endpoints in `DiagnosticsController.cs` for static file diagnostics and testing.
- Refactored `Program.cs` middleware pipeline for proper static file serving and added debug logging.
- Integrated `build:promptspark` step in `package.json` for area-specific asset builds.
- Improved `clean.js` and `npm_build.js` for better error handling, directory management, and fallback mechanisms.
- Optimized `main.scss` by removing redundant imports and using selective Bootstrap imports.
- Removed legacy `web.config` to fix static file serving issues.
- Enhanced `_Layout.cshtml` with breadcrumbs, floating actions, and area-specific styles/scripts.
- Added dynamic meta tag generation in `_metatags.cshtml` for SEO improvements.
- Introduced dynamic navigation rendering in `_Navigation.cshtml` based on JSON configuration.
- Added area-specific styles in `PromptSpark.min.css` with animations and utility classes.
- Documented architecture, troubleshooting, and build fixes in markdown files.

These changes improve build reliability, optimize asset sizes, and enhance the user experience with a scalable architecture for area-specific functionality.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Refactor chat UI and remove SignalR test page

Refactored `Variant.cshtml` to enhance the chat interface with a modern design, markdown rendering, and improved streaming message handling. Introduced `PromptSpark.min.css` for consistent styling and updated `WebSpark.Portal.csproj` to include the new CSS folder.

Added a test method in `ChatHub.cs` to validate markdown rendering with various elements like bold text, code blocks, and lists.

Streamlined `PromptSpark.min.css` by removing unnecessary metadata and the `@charset "UTF-8";` declaration.

Removed `signalr-test.html`, including its HTML structure, SignalR connection logic, and UI components, as part of a shift in testing strategy.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Add SignalR for real-time AI chat and enhancements

Introduced SignalR for real-time communication in WebSpark.Portal, focusing on AI chat interfaces and streaming responses. Added `ChatHub`, `PromptSparkHub`, and `CrawlHub` with features like message streaming, conversation isolation, and logging.

Updated CORS policies and registered SignalR services in `Program.cs`. Enhanced security with input validation, rate limiting, and lifecycle management. Added Azure SignalR Service integration for production scaling.

Refactored `ChatHub` for better performance, added JSON mode detection, and thread-safe caching. Improved error handling with new views for 403, 404, 405, and 500 errors. Simplified UI by removing toast notifications.

Added diagnostics tools, including a SignalR test page (`signalr-test.html`) and `/chathub/test` endpoint. Upgraded SignalR library to `7.0.9`. Enhanced logging and middleware for better debugging and monitoring.

Improved build and testing workflow to include SignalR CORS configuration testing and ensured compatibility across browsers and devices.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Modernize PromptSpark with UI, UX, and performance updates

Updated documentation, controllers, and views to align with a modular architecture and modern design system. Enhanced UI/UX with responsive layouts, animations, and accessibility improvements. Refactored controllers for better error handling, logging, and performance. Introduced a unified CSS system with reusable components and dark mode support. Improved build system and security practices, ensuring maintainability and scalability.

- Added middleware for lowercase URL redirection.

value.message:
Enhance WebSpark CMS with comprehensive blog management and full CRUD implementation

- Resolved compilation errors in WebSpark.Portal, achieving successful build with 464 warnings.
- Implemented BlogItem model property references and fixed Author model reference issues.
- Corrected Razor syntax errors in Post Edit view and addressed NotFoundMiddleware header warnings.
- Developed Blog Management Controllers (BlogController, PostController, AuthorController, CategoryController) for managing blog settings, posts, authors, and categories.
- Enhanced WebCMS dashboard with new cards for blog posts, authors, categories, and recent posts.
- Updated navigation and user experience with improved create menu and help documentation.
- Implemented full CRUD functionality for Post and Blog entities, including advanced features like dual view modes, real-time search, and markdown support.
- Fixed Post Details view by creating the missing Razor view and correcting model references.
- Ensured responsive design and accessibility across all views, with a focus on user experience and security.

Initialize properties with default values across models

- Updates to handle nullable properties in extension methods and filters.
- Modifications to the project file for fixed assembly versioning.

- Updated `SelectColumn.cshtml` to utilize the new ViewModel, enhancing the user interface for selecting columns with improved styling and functionality.

value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Refactor controllers and update package dependencies

This commit includes significant updates to various C# source files, focusing on modifying namespaces, using directives, and class definitions. Key changes involve the removal of unused `using` statements in `SanityCheckController.cs` and `FilesController.cs`, and a substantial refactor in `CsvAIProcessingController_NEW.cs`.

Additionally, the `OpenAIFileAnalysisService.cs` file now includes `Microsoft.Extensions.Options`, indicating a shift in options management. Multiple project files have been updated to reference newer versions of NuGet packages, such as `Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection` and `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore`, enhancing functionality and security.

Improvements in string handling were made in `DefinitionResponseDto_Extension.cs` and `JsonCleaner.cs`, promoting clarity and consistency. Overall, these changes reflect a commitment to code quality, maintainability, and modernization of dependencies.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat: Enhance CSV AI Processing Service with file management and multi-file analysis capabilities

- Implemented a new file management system allowing users to upload, list, and remove CSV files for future analysis.
- Added methods for analyzing multiple uploaded files together and enhanced single file analysis with options to keep files.
- Updated CsvAIProcessingController to support new actions for file management and analysis.
- Improved user interface with file selection dropdowns and analysis controls.
- Fixed CSV file loading issues by ensuring proper file processing and assistant configuration validation.
- Added diagnostic tools for troubleshooting and enhanced error handling throughout the service.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Refactor CSV analysis and enhance AI integration

This commit introduces significant changes to the DataSpark web application, focusing on CSV file analysis and OpenAI integration. Key updates include:

- Replaced `Dashboard` actions in HomeController, UnivariateController, and VisualizationController with `CompleteAnalysis` for improved functionality.
- Added new `CsvAIProcessingController` to handle CSV uploads and AI analysis.
- Introduced `OpenAIFileAnalysisService` to manage interactions with the OpenAI API.
- Enhanced error handling in `CsvFileService` for loading CSV files.
- Created new views for `CompleteAnalysis` and `Index` to facilitate user interaction.
- Improved SignalR hub in `ChatHub` for streaming responses and error handling.
- Added `DiagnosticsController` for testing SignalR connections.
- Updated CSS for better UI presentation.
- Various project configuration updates, including package version upgrades and user secrets management.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: Refactore DataSpark.Web and stand alone compled Data Analysis Solution
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Enhance functionality and UI across the application

- Added logging and error handling in HomeController.
- Implemented validation checks for uploaded CSV files in FilesController.
- Updated package references in DataSpark.Web.csproj for compatibility.
- Integrated Bootswatch theme switcher in Program.cs and _Layout.cshtml.
- Improved user interface in Files.cshtml and Index.cshtml for better usability.
- Cleaned up site.css and site.js for responsiveness.
- Updated configuration settings in appsettings.json files.
- Reflected dependency updates in package.json and package-lock.json.
- Added multiple curl commands for API interactions in curl_commands.csv.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Clean up
Switch to NuGet Package for WebSpark.Bootswatch (delete project)
and WebSpark.HttpUtilities instead of HttpClientCrawler (delete project)
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Update dependencies and enhance GitHub user search

Updated various NuGet package references to their latest versions, primarily from version 9.0.4 to 9.0.5.

Added new methods in the `HomeController` for handling GraphQL API requests, including user data fetching and searching. Introduced a `GitHubApiException` constructor for better exception handling.

Enhanced the `GitHubUserService` to support GraphQL queries and updated the `Index.cshtml` view to include a search button for the GraphQL API.

Also made changes to the `package-lock.json` to reflect updates in JavaScript dependencies and updated binary files for Bootstrap icons.
value.author: Mark Hazleton
